channel.title: Help java mac
channel.description: I have a server and some people are unable to connect to the server due to there java being outdated (don't say to update cause they can't) they have an older version of OS X so they can't update there java further than it already is so I'd like to make it so it works for any version of java that you have regardless of what java I compiled the client with. Thanks!

item.title: Help java mac
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:8, topic:527640”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646394.msg4347296#msg4347296 date=1376074262]

I’m sure you don’t need to support that many versions… so just compile a few jars and select the right one depending on the version.

Depends on what version of OSX they have.
This is why I hate crapple. Why would you limit what software is supported?
[/quote]$$. Microsoft pull the same shit in different ways.[/quote]rep++ Linux anybody? Oh wait they do the same thing just don’t want to admit it…

Read full topic

item.title: Help java mac
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I am Nick:

Well on all the big servers I can load their clients. So I should get a low version of java and compile it with that low version and how low is too low? And yes they are unable to load it cause their version of java Apple makes you have to get their new operating systems to get a newer version of java so they are stuck with and old java and it won’t load the client because I compiled it with a higher version of java.

Yes, I know how crApple works.
Just, if you’re running a PI or delta, you should be fine with JDK 6 update 25 but I may be wrong, and that link is an archive of all jdk 6. [You may need to get an oracle login]

Read full topic

item.title: Help java mac
item.dc:creator: @I_am_Nick I am Nick
item.description:
@I_am_Nick wrote:

Well on all the big servers I can load their clients. So I should get a low version of java and compile it with that low version and how low is too low? And yes they are unable to load it cause their version of java Apple makes you have to get their new operating systems to get a newer version of java so they are stuck with and old java and it won’t load the client because I compiled it with a higher version of java.

item.title: Help java mac
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s erm… That isn’t possible…
The only way you could even think to make it work with “any” java version, is to compile it with a lower version than they have.
If you use too low of a version, you’ll get an unsupported error.
Have fun.

Read full topic
